# Time
### Plot Raw Data
```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
hist(allData$Response.Time)

library(plyr)
library(dplyr)
ddply(allData, ~ Method, function(data) summary(allData$Response.Time))
ddply(allData, ~ Method, summarise, Response.Time=mean(Response.Time), Response.Time=sd(Response.Time))

plot(Response.Time ~ Method, data=allData)
```

### Check the normality <0.05 not normally distributed 

```{r}
shapiro.test(allData[allData$Method == "TAP",]$Response.Time)
shapiro.test(allData[allData$Method == "SWIPE",]$Response.Time)
shapiro.test(allData[allData$Method == "MIDAIR",]$Response.Time)
shapiro.test(allData$Response.Time)
```

### qqplot 

```{r}
qqnorm(allData$Response.Time, pch = 1, frame = FALSE)
qqline(allData$Response.Time, col = "steelblue")
```

### residuals

```{r}
m = aov(Response.Time ~ Method, data=allData) # fit model
shapiro.test(residuals(m)) # test residuals
qqnorm(residuals(m)); qqline(residuals(m)) # q-q plot residuals
```

### log-transform and check the normality 

```{r}
allData$logRTime = log(allData$Response.Time)
plot(logRTime ~ Method, data=allData)
hist(allData$logRTime)
```

```{r}
shapiro.test(allData[allData$Method == "TAP",]$logRTime)
shapiro.test(allData[allData$Method == "SWIPE",]$logRTime)
shapiro.test(allData[allData$Method == "MIDAIR",]$logRTime)
shapiro.test(allData$logRTime)
```

### qqplot 

```{r}
qqnorm(allData$logRTime, pch = 1, frame = FALSE)
qqline(allData$logRTime, col = "steelblue")
```

### one-way ANOVA, suitable now to logTime

```{r}
m = aov(logRTime ~ Method, data=allData) # fit model
anova(m) # report anova
library(multcomp)
summary(glht(m, mcp(Method="Tukey")), test=adjusted(type="holm")) # Tukey means compare all pairs
```

### Friedman Test

```{r}
par = 'logRTime'
friedman.test(y = newData[[par]], groups = newData$Method, blocks = newData$PID)
pairwise.wilcox.test(newData[[par]], newData$Method, p.adj = 'bonf')
```
